properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued For The Village Of Loreburn.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Loreburn. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Village of Loreburn water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-06-28T09:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Loreburn, 2019-06-24T15:00:53-06:00, F61CB436-87EB-CA4A-5F4B-F59561F0A92B
Area: Village of Loreburn
properties.Author: SK Loreburn

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain will continue through the day today before tapering to scattered showers later this evening. Total rainfall amounts of 30 to 40 mm are possible. This rainfall may lead to localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-25T17:06:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T09:07:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3531346081.2019
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and reduced visibility at times. The smoke from the wildfires is now fairly localized. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-26T02:56:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-25T10:57:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0720147783.2019
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La CrÃªte and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. A cool airmass combined with clear skies and light winds will result in patchy frost overnight tonight as temperatures approach zero, especially in low lying or inland areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-26T05:16:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T13:17:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3931709371.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Buchans and the interior, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies combined with light winds will give patchy frost overnight tonight and early Tuesday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-25T16:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T01:58:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1537184938.2019
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The Dene Thaâ First Nationâs Bushe River, and Beaver First Nationâs Child Lake, & Boyer River reserves remain evacuated, and the public must stay out of these areas. The evacuation order is lifted for the area of Rocky Lane and the rural High Level area north of the Peace River, west of Range Rd. 150, south of Highway 58 and south and southeast of High Level, and the public can return to this area.### Everyone returning back to the area of Rocky Lane and the rural High Level area must be prepared to evacuate on short notice and should continue to monitor the Mackenzie County Facebook page due to wildfire activity in the area. The Hamlet of La Crete, and the rural area outside the hamlet, north and south of Highway 697, east of Range Rd. 150, south of the Peace River must be prepared to evacuate on short notice and they should continue to monitor the Mackenzie County Facebook page for more information. Go to the following locations regarding further information. Dene Thaâ First Nation www.facebook.com/DeneThaFirstNation/ for more information. Beaver First Nation: For additional information follow our Facebook page or Contact: Chief Trevor Mercredi â 780-247-0851 Director of Emergency Management - Riel Chonkolay 780-247-4444 Deputy Director of Emergency Management â Daphne Lizotte 780-247-0010 More information is also available at www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ for Mackenzie County residents. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-07-01T14:28:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency On Behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-24T14:26:36-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5874
Area: Mackenzie #23
